de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class AbstractMaterialDialogFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • android.support.v4.app.DialogFragment
        • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractMaterialDialogFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.DialogInterface, android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, Dialog, MaterialDialog, MaterialDialogDecorator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractHeaderDialogFragment

    public abstract class AbstractMaterialDialogFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.DialogFragment
implements MaterialDialog
    An abstract base class for all dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and are able to show fragments.
    Since:
    3.2.0

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractMaterialDialogFragment

        protected AbstractMaterialDialogFragment(@NonNull
                                         android.content.Context context,
                                         @StyleRes
                                         int themeResourceId)
        Creates a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and is able to show fragments.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the dialog, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme

    • Method Detail

      • onAttachDecorators

        @CallSuper
protected void onAttachDecorators(@NonNull
                                             android.view.View view,
                                             @NonNull
                                             android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fragmentManager)
        The method, which is invoked when the dialog's decorators should be attached. This method may be overridden by subclasses in order to attach additional decorators.
        Parameters:
        view - The root view of the view hierarchy, which should be modified by the decorators, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
        fragmentManager - The fragment manager, which can be used to show fragment within the dialog, as an instance of the class FragmentManager. The fragment manager may not be null

      • onDetachDecorators

        @CallSuper
protected void onDetachDecorators()
        The method, which is invoked when the dialog's decorators should be detached. This method must be overridden by subclasses if they attach additional decorators.

      • setOnCancelListener

        public final void setOnCancelListener(@Nullable
                                      android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: MaterialDialog
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the dialog is canceled. Even in a cancelable dialog, the dialog may be dismissed for reasons other than being canceled or one of the supplied choices being selected. If you are interested in listening for all cases where the dialog is dismissed and not just when it is canceled, see setOnDismissListener.
        Specified by:
        setOnCancelListener in interface MaterialDialog
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, or null, if no listener should be set
        See Also:
        MaterialDialog.setCancelable(boolean), MaterialDialog.setOnDismissListener(android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener)
